sections.heading: What is HTML?
sections.text: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is the standard language used to structure content on the web. Web browsers read HTML and display it as formatted pages.

sections.heading: What are Tags?
sections.text:
Tags are the building blocks of HTML. A tag tells the browser how to display or interpret a piece of content. Most tags have an opening part, like

, and a closing part, like

.

sections.heading: Elements
sections.text: An element is everything between an opening tag and a closing tag.

sections.heading: Common Tags
sections.text:
Some basic tags include

sections.heading: Attributes
sections.text: Tags can have attributes that add extra information. For example, the <a> tag uses the href attribute to point to a URL.

sections.heading: Unordered Lists
sections.text: Unordered lists display items with bullet points. Use the <ul> tag for the list and <li> for each item.

sections.heading: Ordered Lists
sections.text: Ordered lists display items with numbers. Use the <ol> tag for the list and <li> for each item.

sections.heading: Adding Images
sections.text: The tag is used to display images. It needs a src attribute to specify the image file, and an alt attribute to describe the image.
